discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Use the processing group options to either import or export data. For import, you first import the data to a staging table, where you can clean or transform the data as you require. You should validate that the data appears accurate, and that the reference data is mapped correctly. You then migrate the data from the staging table to the target table. You should validate that the entity appears accurate in the target table.

For export, you also move the data from the source to a staging table, where you can clean or transform the data as you require.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamicsax-2012/appuser-itpro/data-import-export-framework-user-guide-dixf-dmf#architecture

Selected Answer: D
The Data Import/Export Framework creates a staging table for each entity in the Microsoft Dynamics AX database where the target table resides. Data that is being migrated is first moved to the staging table. There, you can verify the data, and perform any cleanup or conversion that is required. You can then move the data to the target table or export it.
-https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamicsax-2012/appuser-itpro/data-import-export-framework-user-guide-dixf-dmf#architecture

Selected Answer: D
Correct, thatâ€™s what the tool does
Correct Answer is D
Correct Answer is D because it is about Data Import/Export Framework (DIXF) not DMT.

I think it is C
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/migration-upgrade/data-migration-tool

"You can use the Microsoft Dynamics AX 2009 Data migration tool (DMT) to migrate your data from AX 2009 to Finance and Operations. Using the DMT is the only supported upgrade path from AX 2009. The DMT helps you find and fill gaps between the table schemas for each version, as well as helping you move your data."

No, the correct answer is D. The question asked about the Data Import/Export Framework (DIXF) not DMT.
As mentioned on the site: "The Data Import/Export Framework creates a staging table for each entity in the Microsoft Dynamics AX database where the target table resides."
Reference link: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamicsax-2012/appuser-itpro/data-import-export-framework-user-guide-dixf-dmf

questions.question_text:
You are preparing to migrate to a Dynamics 365 Finance environment from Dynamics AX 2009.
You plan to make use of the Data Import/Export Framework (DIXF) tool to create a data package from a group of entities in Dynamics AX 2009.
Which of the following is TRUE with regards to Data Import/Export Framework (DIXF) tool?

choices.D: It creates a staging table for each entity in the Microsoft Dynamics AX database where the target table resides, where you can validate the data, and perform any clean up or conversion that is needed.
choices.B: It produces an upgraded version of your code and a report about the remaining conflicts that must be resolved.
choices.A: It identifies tasks that you should do to prepare the AX 2012 environment.
choices.C: It helps you find and fill gaps between the table schemas for each version, as well as helping you move your data.

Users import huge amounts of data into the system every day. You want to optimize the performance for the imports.

discussion.content: The correct answer is B, Multi threading is used for the performance optimization

Selected Answer: B
Option B is right answer

Answer "B - Incorrect" is the right answer, features are enabled/disabled through the "Feature Management workspace", not through LCS --> Solution management
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/fin-ops/get-started/feature-management/feature-management-overview

Selected Answer: B
No, it is activated through Feature managment

A. Yes, it does.

Enabling a new feature in Solution management typically activates that feature and makes it available for use within your Dynamics 365 environment. This action should enable the new feature for you.

B. No, it does not.

Enabling a new feature in Solution management within Microsoft Dynamics 365 does not automatically enable the feature itself. The action of enabling the feature in Solution management simply makes the feature available for configuration and inclusion in solutions.

To enable the new feature, additional steps are usually required. This may include configuring the feature settings, activating the feature within the application, or enabling it at the organization level. Enabling a feature in Solution management is just one part of the process and does not activate the feature itself.

Therefore, the correct answer is B. No, it does not.
Selected Answer: B

Selected Answer: B
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/fin-ops/get-started/feature-management/feature-management-overview#enable-a-feature

Microsoft releases a new feature for public preview that does not require additional licensing.
You want to enable the new feature.
You enable the feature in Solution management.
Does this action enable the new feature?

Users import huge amounts of data into the system every day. You want to optimize the performance for the imports.
You enable change tracking for the data entities.
Has your objective been met?

discussion.content:
